criteria: Creating and Interpreting Tables of Equivalent Ratios
Use of Visual Representations (Tape Diagrams, Double Number Lines, Coordinate Plane)
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of ratios or rates.
Student demonstrates minimal understanding of ratios or rates, struggling to identify them in simple contexts.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of ratios and rates but struggles to apply them to solve problems.
Student can identify and use ratios and rates in some real-world and mathematical problems, but makes frequent errors.
Student can effectively use ratios and rates to solve real-world and mathematical problems with occasional errors.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of ratios and rates and can accurately solve complex real-world and mathematical problems.
Student is unable to create or interpret tables of equivalent ratios.
Student struggles to create tables of equivalent ratios and cannot accurately find missing values.
Student can create basic tables of equivalent ratios but has difficulty finding missing values or comparing ratios.
Student can create tables of equivalent ratios, find missing values, and compare ratios with some errors.
Student can accurately create tables of equivalent ratios, find missing values, and use them to compare ratios effectively.
Student demonstrates mastery in creating and interpreting tables of equivalent ratios, using them to solve complex problems and make insightful comparisons.
Student does not use or understand visual representations of ratios.
Student attempts to use visual representations but struggles to create accurate or meaningful diagrams.
Student can create basic visual representations but struggles to use them to solve problems.
Student can use visual representations to solve some problems, but the diagrams may contain errors or be unclear.
Student effectively uses visual representations to solve problems, with clear and accurate diagrams.
Student demonstrates skillful use of visual representations to solve complex ratio problems, providing clear and insightful diagrams.
